actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.
Reported to House from the Committee on Ways and Means with amendment, H. Rept. 95-1357.
Measure called up by unanimous consent in House.
Referred to Senate Committee on Finance.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Finance with amendment, S. Rept. 95-1242.
House agreed to certain Senate amendments.

House disagreed to certain Senate amendment.

official_title: A bill to continue until the close of June 30, 1981, the existing suspension of duties on certain forms of zinc.

summary.as: Senate agreed to House amendment with amendment
summary.text: (Senate agreed to House amendment to certain Senate amendment with an amendment) Amends the Tariff Schedules of the United States: (1) to extend until June 30, 1981, the suspension of duties on specified forms of zinc; and (2) to permit temporary duty-free imports of soluble nitrocellulose. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to reduce for one year: (1) the passenger ticket tax for domestic air transportation from eight percent to six percent; (2) the tax for use of international air travel facilities from three dollars to one dollar; and (3) the tax on the transportation of property by air from five percent to three percent.

titles.title: A bill to continue until the close of June 30, 1981, the existing suspension of duties on certain forms of zinc.
